title: JavaScript Graphics

metadata.description: Learn about JavaScript Graphics with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Graphic Libraries
JavaScript libraries to use for all kinds of graphs:
Plotly.js
Chart.js
Google Chart
Plotly.js
Plotly.js is a charting library that comes with over 40 chart types, 3D charts, statistical graphs, and SVG maps.
Learn More ...
Chart.js
Chart.js comes with many built-in chart types:
Scatter
Line
Bar
Radar
Pie and Doughnut
Polar Area
Bubble
Learn More ...
Google Chart
From simple line charts to complex tree maps,
Google Chart provides a number of built-in chart types:
Scatter Chart
Line Chart
Bar / Column Chart
Area Chart
Pie Chart
Donut Chart
Org Chart
Map / Geo Chart
Learn More ...

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: Javascript Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is js?
options: a charting library that comes with over 40 chart types
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of js is 'a charting library that comes with over 40 chart types'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this javascript feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers JavaScript Graphics concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavaScript Graphics effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavaScript Graphics and how to apply it in your projects.
